headline.main: I.B.M. Puts Watson to Work in Business

docs.abstract: I.B.M. will move its Watson artificial-intelligence technology into the business mainstream with an offering pitched as a smart assistant especially useful in industries with many customer service calls.
docs.snippet: I.B.M. will move its Watson artificial-intelligence technology into the business mainstream with an offering pitched as a smart assistant especially useful in industries with many customer service calls.

docs.lead_paragraph: The cost of claims for people with serious medical conditions has exhausted most of the $5 billion provided by Congress for the health insurance program.

headline.main: Overruns Forcing Lower Payments to Some Providers in Stopgap Health Program
headline.print_headline: Overruns Forcing Lower Payments to Some Providers in Stopgap Health Program

docs.abstract: Obama administration says it is cutting payments to doctors and hospitals after finding that cost overruns are threatening to drain money available in health insurance program for people with cancer, heart disease and other serious illnesses; 135,000 of expected 400,000 have enrolled in program, but cost of claims has far exceeded White House estimates.
docs.snippet: The cost of claims for people with serious medical conditions has exhausted most of the $5 billion provided by Congress for the health insurance program.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans seize on two controversies to block the means to help the uninsured.

headline.seo: New Efforts to Undercut Health Reforms
headline.main: New Efforts to Undercut Health Reforms
headline.print_headline: New Efforts to Undercut Health Reforms

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Congressional Republicans for exploiting controversies surrounding the Internal Revenue Service and Health and Human Services Sec Kathleen Sebelius in attempt to undermine Pres Obama's health care law; holds moves are in line with enormous amount of time wasted by the House in vain effort to repeal law.
docs.snippet: Republicans seize on two controversies to block the means to help the uninsured.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: When we can sequence 20,000 genes for $1,000, why should it cost nearly $4,000 to analyze just two?

headline.seo: The Outrageous Cost of a Gene Test
headline.main: The Outrageous Cost of a Gene Test
headline.print_headline: The Outrageous Cost of a Gene Test

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by oncologist David B Agus maintains Myriad Genetics, company that provides genetic testing for rare forms of breast cancer, is exploiting its patent ownership to charge exorbitant sums; calls for legislative action for rational and appropriate price limits on genetic testing, which can often be done in cheap and effective manner.
docs.snippet: When we can sequence 20,000 genes for $1,000, why should it cost nearly $4,000 to analyze just two?

docs.lead_paragraph: A report by the RAND Corporation said it was not clear how emergency rooms affected health care costs.

headline.seo: Half of Hospital Admissions From Emergency Rooms
headline.main: E.R.’s Account for Half of Hospital Admissions, Study Says
headline.print_headline: E.R.’s Account for Half of Hospital Admissions, Study Says

docs.abstract: RAND Corporation study finds that emergency rooms account for about half of nation's hospital admissions and accounted for virtually all of the rise in admissions between 2003 and 2009; findings raise important question about how emergency rooms contribute to high care costs in United States and what their role will be in future.
docs.snippet: A report by the RAND Corporation said it was not clear how emergency rooms affected health care costs.

keywords.name: subject

headline.main: No Easy Choices on Breast Reconstruction

docs.abstract: While a recent article by Angelina Jolie about her mastectomy and reconstruction raised awareness, it may have left the impression that the surgeries are quick and easy procedures, some doctors fear.
docs.snippet: While a recent article by Angelina Jolie about her mastectomy and reconstruction raised awareness, it may have left the impression that the surgeries are quick and easy procedures, some doctors fear.

docs.abstract: The board of Yahoo agrees to buy Tumblr for about $1.1 billion in cash. | Steven A. Cohen of SAC Capital has received a subpoena to testify before a grand jury. | Shareholders of JPMorgan Chase will have the opportunity to deliver a rebuff to Jamie Dimon. | BlackRock has become more active in recent years.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Congress investigates solicitations, some corporations and philanthropies are reluctant to contribute to an outreach program to help with the president’s health care law.

headline.seo: Potential Donors to Enroll America Grow Skittish
headline.main: Potential Donors to Enroll America Grow Skittish
headline.print_headline: Amid Inquiry Into Fund-Raising for Health Law, Potential Donors Grow Skittish

docs.abstract: Obama administration's efforts to raise private money to carry out president's health care law have reportedly provoked such a strong partisan uproar that some corporations and philanthropies have become skittish about contributing.
docs.snippet: As Congress investigates solicitations, some corporations and philanthropies are reluctant to contribute to an outreach program to help with the president’s health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: A super-class thrives as ordinary dreams die.

headline.seo: Inequality and the Modern Culture of Celebrity

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author George Packer examines way in which plethora of celebrities from every sector of society shows how a super-class in America thrives while ordinary Americans are being left behind.
docs.snippet: A super-class thrives as ordinary dreams die.

headline.main: Disruptions: Helper Robots Are Steered, Tentatively, to Care for the Aging
headline.print_headline: Helper Robots Are Steered, Tentatively, to Care for Aging

docs.abstract: With a growing population of Americans over the age of 65, but a lack of trained home health care workers, more and more people could hire robots to do the job.
docs.snippet: With a growing population of Americans over the age of 65, but a lack of trained home health care workers, more and more people could hire robots to do the job.
